column4: Hey. I'm trying to completely remove all traces of samba from my system and start again with it from the start but when I do aptituce search samba, next to 3 of the items I've got 'pi'. What does this mean, and how do I get rid of them?

the most common states are p, meaning that no trace of the package
2012-02-07T04:36:00.000Z	kjaer	antnash	found it here: http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/jaunty/man8/aptitude.8.html
2012-02-07T04:37:00.000Z	antnash	kjaer	How would I go about removing something that's both purged and removed?
